thread.title: South Carolina Coach Steve Spurrier Retiring, Effective Immediately
thread.title_full: South Carolina Coach Steve Spurrier Retiring, Effective Immediately

title: South Carolina Coach Steve Spurrier Retiring, Effective Immediately
text: Monday, October 12 2015, 10:03 PM EDT South Carolina Coach Steve Spurrier Retiring, Effective Immediately COLUMBIA, SC ( WACH ) - Sports Illustrated has reported that USC head coach Steve Spurrier has retired, effective immediately.According to SI, the 70-year-old coach told his players his decision Monday night.Spurrier is scheduled to have a news conference Tuesday at 11:30am.An interim coach for the remainder of the season is expected to be announced by Wednesday morning.A reason behind the sudden decision has not been made known to the public.Currently, USC sits at 2-4 and has lost all four of its SEC game this season.Spurrier has been in charge of the Gamecocks since 2005 and has a 86-49 career record at the school.Spurrier led USC to three straight 11 win season (2011-13) and won the SEC East division title in 2010.His career record between USC, Florida and Duke is 228-89-2.Photo From WACH South Carolina Coach Steve Spurrier Retiring, Effective Immediately Related Stories
